full_summary:
### RISO-Duct, Canopy, and HVAC Cleaning
#### Tender Announcement PW- HAL-411-11603

**Tender Number:** W6899-220079/A
**Publication Date:** November 28, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** December 15, 2022, 13:00:00
**Status:** Expired

**Description:** 
Public Services and Procurement Canada invites eligible suppliers to submit a Request for Standing Offers (RFSO) for the services of RISO-Duct, Canopy, and HVAC Cleaning.

**Services Required:** 
The Department of National Defence requires a Regional Individual Standing Offer (RISO) for the provision of all labor, materials, and equipment necessary to clean ducts and canopies and HVAC systems at various locations at 14 Wing Greenwood and remote sites.

**Basis of Selection:** 
Offers must meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive offer with the lowest evaluated price will be selected.

**Period of Standing Offer:** 
The RISO will be valid for two years, with two additional one-year options.

**Trade Agreements:** 
This tender is open to suppliers who have a valid agreement under the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), or the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

**Region of Delivery:** 
This RISO is intended for use in Nova Scotia.

**Contact Information:**

• Erin Surette, Contracting Authority
• Email: erin.surette@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca
• Phone: (902) 476-5077
• Fax: (902) 496-5016
• Address: 1713 Bedford Row, Halifax, NS B3J 1T3

**Submission Instructions:** 
To submit a bid, please use Canada Post Corporation's CPC Connect Service or fax to (902) 496-5016. Bidders must be registered and have an active profile on SAP Ariba to access the tender package and submit their bids electronically.

The contracting authority will not accept bids sent directly to the email address of the contracting authority.

Additional information can be found in the solicitation package. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
